comment: He is terrible. There is homework every night. Answers have to be in complete sentences. This is not English comp.
It is not an easy class. Expects a lot. A lot of work to get a C.

Took him Fall06. Not a favorite and does not try to be. High workload. No nonsense. Expects a lot. Knows his stuff. Very smart. Class is easier than it seems if you pay attention in class and take good notes. Read the notes on CourseCompass.

Lectures are thorough and understandable because he took extra steps to explain problems and solutions. Summer course - so it was a LOT of work! Prof Mundkur taught at a higher level than we were used to, but it pushed us. Better do HW before the class talk, when I figured that out, topic was less hard. Test are written explaination and numbermash.

I have to say, i couldn't stand this class. He kept screwing up on problems, which confused me. He assigned obnoxious amounts of homework with REALLY hard problems. And he never gave our midterm back, even though we had a ****ulative final...so we were never able to see what we had done bad on and needed help on. I would never recommend him

Here's how I see it. You can choose to be mediocre or actually make the most of your education. He wants you to learn how to think analytically. Being in secondary education I understand what he is trying to do. Paying for a health club membership and personal trainer does not guarantee washboard abs, does it? You still have to work out.

He is one of the smartest instructors I have had. He knows his subject inside out. He comes across without feeling, but he is really easy to talk to, will answer email and welcome you to his office to talk. Exams are not traditional but fair and balanced. You have to understand what you are doing and why you are doing it.

You have to do brute force method of study. You work things really hard, email professor once a week with questions or concerns about course material, and do all of the problems per section. Then work your section problems until they are second nature and stay realistic and continuously test yourself because of how math is comprehensive.

Did the fish want to learn how to swim? If it did not it should drown. Were you the slacker who came to class late, listened to your iPod during class instead of paying attention, and wanted to copy my answers during the final?

Last poster(may 30) - you should not waste time in college. He teaches for depth and understanding. I took the class last fall and still remember what I learned. You have to earn a grade in his class and he tells you that. He tells you what he expects, did you listen or understand? This is not a blow off class-change your major or section.
I know it is 1106 not 1160 but it should be. It is def much harder than 1107(stat). Me and my friend took it and got through it somehow. Get a study buddy. No book buyback - bummer.
If you want easy, dont take him. Combine his class with microecon and it all makes a lot of sense (and pile of work). I am studying for the GMAT now and, guess what, easy!!!
He is a calculus coach. If you have played sports with a    coach then it will make sense to you.

I'm about to finish 4 week course and the study habits learned from his class saved me. Not an easy class and he does use calc/formal vocab BUT that is to get us to use it properly when we write-its his language lab! I asked this when he met with each person in class. Just ask why he does some crazy things. Nice, smart BUT takes getting use to.

Nice and intelligent guy, not a great teacher.  In the majority of his lectures, he explained the material as though he were talking to another Calc prof., not a intro. to Calc class.  Class requires(in my opinion) way more than should be expecteced from an Intro. Calc. class for  mostly business majors.  Crazy grading policy as well.

fast paced interactive lecture - comes prepared for class, so you have to as well. he pushes class to think beyond what we normally would - some did not like this. easy course IF you do the work. B because I was lazy about half of mymathlab work - keep up with homework it was worth a letter grade to me. kicking myself now.

I liked the fact that he put so much time in putting notes on the internet and drawing pictures. very nice, caring and helpful teacher. I liked how tests were more of an english style with writing out why you did something. Tests seemed hard, but made me really study. I did not understand his grading system, but understood calculus, made an A:-)

class/extra notes clear. related concepts to tangable things. i liked how tests challenged you to think. class is a lot of work  but you learn something. answers all questions (sometimes with more questions). i belief it's his way of getting you to think and figure out the answer for yourself.

One of the only classes that made me actually think and understand the content instead of memorizing. Went over every question and explained reasoning and meaning behind each problem. Posts helpful notes. Very quick on e-mail replies. Personable. Very smart which can be intimidating. Wish he taught econ as well.

Challenging course - material, teaching style, expects a lot, not easy. Class requires a lot of energy, but topics came together. He frustrates because he is not like every other prof. Grading system allowed me to take my mind off the grade and focus on learning. Not knowing exact interim grade was very uncomfortable, in the end does not seem bad.

Calculus is not easy and if you want to learn something and are interested in the subject I recommend you take him. He does not just give you the answer, he makes you think and figure things out. Let's be real that is how life is, you need to figure things out. Things don't just come to you nor the answers. Very good and quick at responding to emai
This class was one of the hardest I have ever taken. I withdrew from it about a month and a half into the semester. This professor makes no sense. Do not take him. His test was like essay style.
Steer clear of this guy... he's is horrible
i just quit going..his class is so hard.
This class will make you work. IT'S CALCULUS..COME ON! If you work the class will be ok. This is not a class that has mandatory attendance but if you miss it you better know calculus.

Lets be honest Calculus is not easy to learn or to teach.  I think he did the best he could and there is no doubt that he is brilliant at Calculus.Do not buy the book just buy My Math Lab.  Got a 100 on all of the homework failed all the tests.Somehow got an A on final and an A in the class. He must have curved.Class is extremely hard.
He is the smartest math teacher I have ever had, but he makes no sense!!!!!!!!!!! He has no idea how to explain his knowledge to his students.  He seriously confused me over the simplest things.
This teacher is unfairly hard.
teaching ability is poor, is not able to explain calculus. He only knows calculus. He should not be teaching elementary calculus.

Do NOT Take! All homework was online. I did everyone.. went back and got 100% on ALL of it and still FAILED this class. Final was like 11 pages and impossible. He taught nothing and expected everything. If you're not good at math, he is the WORST!

great person, worst teacher!!! take him if you are a math major who has no life but to "journey" through the history of mathematics in order to understand the most common concepts! Man drove me up the wall...I made an A but i had to WORK for that A!
good person, bad teacher

I am an A,B student, and this teach gave me a D!! He is so awful, please save your self and dont take HIM!! you will be sorry.  His class has no structure, and its just him showing the students, what he knows. Last semester he passed out a timed test, and didn't even tell us it was timed!!I came to class every day and tried, and he gave me a D!
He's not very clear on what he wants from the class. He is helpful if you have a question, but it doesn't really matter what you know because his tests are obscure.

DO NOT TAKE!!!! You cannot understand his foreign self. He is sooo hard and expects too much out of you. If you want to save yourself take someone else. He will fail you and never look back. He is not helpful and does not care about you in anyway possible.
i hear he drops it like it's hot

I took this class on Spring 2005. At first I thought he was very mean, but rather than being mean he wants to make students push themselves to learn instead of memorize. If you do all the homework, ask questions (email him), show up to class and on time. You will pass. He curves the tests He is a great professor, I learned a lot from him :)
No Comments
Horrible, Horrible, Horrible...avoid him like the plague!!!

The class is ridiculously hard!  He treats people like you're back in high school.  He occasionally wants to help but if he thinks you aren't trying, good luck because you're on your own.  Started off last semester with 40 something people in the class and I heard he finished with 8 people.  Do not take this class unless you feel that you are up to a challenge because it definently is.
if you have it, dont waste your time and it

He only had one grade for the entire semester, which was a cumulative final. He never assigned homework, or graded tests/quizzes. He said they were evaluative tools, to show us where we need extra practice. And he also said that our final grades would have been the same regardless of whether we'd had 20 grades or 1. It doesn't take a rocket scientist to know that's a bunch of ****...

It's only been 2 weeks and I'm already drowning. The man doesn't explain anything and makes geometry references (in a business class?). If it weren't for my wonderful & patient boyrfriend, I would have les of a clue than I already do. I'm expecting to fail.
aweful teacher. only take him if you feel like failing or dropping half way through semester. no clue about anything related to this course! bleh!
You might as well just teach yourself. If you get him, save yourself a lot of time and pain and drop the class.
No Comments

Can't be as self-righteous as person below, but I also got a B.  Class is work-, time- and web-intensive.  Prof very helpful outside class, not at all in class.  BEWARE:  prof is very negative and derogatory; can at times be very demoralizing.  Would only recommend to angry or masochistic students.

His class is demanding but he is willing to help if you ask. I kept up with the work, others did not - they drowned. Grade expected B. If I had my b**t in gear earlier in the semester I would have made an A.

his theory is that you should teach yourself and then if you dont understand you can ask questions (which he wont answer) the next day. if i wanted to teach myself math i wouldnt a. be paying someone to tell me to teach myself and b. i would have done it along time ago.  i dropped the class in two d
doesn't explain how to solve the problems
UGGGHHHHHHHHHH!!!!
You have no idea what your grade is untill everything is done. When he gives back papers no grades, just check or (x). Would not recommend.
not very clean doesn't give back papers; and doesn't tell you your grade, even if you ask him. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!!!!

Don't take this man. Take everyone else's foolish advice and don't take him. I'm surprised they have him teaching at KSU for so long. Didn't they say that the evaluation sheets counted? I guess they really don't.

Let's see...don't take him. You do not know what your grade is until after you take the final. If you ask how you are doing he asks you how you think youare doing. He shows one example a day on what you learn and just confuses everyone. If you want to learn do not take him! Run away
Nice guy and willing to help but the class was pretty difficult to get through. His tests were hard.

HE is a horrible teacher. math was my favorite subject until i took his class i would not take this class get away. i dropped it after the first test there is stuff on there that we never even covered and he is not very helpful to you when you do not understand the material do not take this class

At first you think "Wow, he just explained math to me, and I got it!". Then the test comes up, and you say "I don't remember covering any of this in class..." If you set apart some time, he will explain it to you outside of class, but he really expects you to learn most of it at home.not recommended
Do not take him for math 1106. reasons why?? 1. he blames the students, even when everyone falls. 2.He makes the class harder than it should be. 3.just a bad teacher
He is a very bad teacher. He blames the students for not understanding the material, when he didn't teach it properly to begin with. DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS!!!!!!!!!!

Excellent Teacher!!! His class was certainly not the easiest I have ever taken, but definitly the most helpful! His class helped me understand math for the first time in my life!!! If you want to learn something, take this class!!!
don't tak him
